name: Additive QT prolongation risk with multiple QT-prolonging drugs

rationale: Both drugs contribute to QT prolongation risk domain.
Combined effects can increase torsades risk, especially with additional risk factors.

explanation_template: {A_name} and {B_name} both have QT-prolongation liability. Using them together can increase QT-related risk. Patient-specific factors (electrolytes, baseline QT, bradycardia, other QT drugs) strongly modify real-world risk.

references.citation: PD stacking: shared QT domain implies additive risk.
